03929       if (chunksize(T) != S) {\
03930         tchunkptr* C = &(T->child[(K >> (SIZE_T_BITSIZE-SIZE_T_ONE)) & 1]);\
03931         K <<= 1;\
03932         if (*C != 0)\
03933           T = *C;\
03934         else if (RTCHECK(ok_address(M, C))) {\
03935           *C = X;\
03936           X->parent = T;\
03937           X->fd = X->bk = X;\
03938           break;\
03939         }\
03940         else {\
03941           CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(M);\
03942           break;\
03943         }\
03944       }\
03945       else {\
03946         tchunkptr F = T->fd;\
03947         if (RTCHECK(ok_address(M, T) && ok_address(M, F))) {\
03948           T->fd = F->bk = X;\
03949           X->fd = F;\
03950           X->bk = T;\
03951           X->parent = 0;\
03952           break;\
03953         }\
03954         else {\
03955           CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(M);\
03956           break;\
03957         }\
03958       }\
03959     }\
03960   }\
03961 }
03962 
03963 /*
03964   Unlink steps:
03965 
03966   1. If x is a chained node, unlink it from its same-sized fd/bk links
03967      and choose its bk node as its replacement.
03968   2. If x was the last node of its size, but not a leaf node, it must
03969      be replaced with a leaf node (not merely one with an open left or
03970      right), to make sure that lefts and rights of descendents
03971      correspond properly to bit masks.  We use the rightmost descendent
03972      of x.  We could use any other leaf, but this is easy to locate and
03973      tends to counteract removal of leftmosts elsewhere, and so keeps
03974      paths shorter than minimally guaranteed.  This doesn't loop much
03975      because on average a node in a tree is near the bottom.
03976   3. If x is the base of a chain (i.e., has parent links) relink
03977      x's parent and children to x's replacement (or null if none).
03978 */
03979 
03980 #define unlink_large_chunk(M, X) {\
03981   tchunkptr XP = X->parent;\
03982   tchunkptr R;\
03983   if (X->bk != X) {\
03984     tchunkptr F = X->fd;\
03985     R = X->bk;\
03986     if (RTCHECK(ok_address(M, F))) {\
03987       F->bk = R;\
03988       R->fd = F;\
03989     }\
03990     else {\
03991       CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(M);\
03992     }\
03993   }\
03994   else {\
03995     tchunkptr* RP;\
03996     if (((R = *(RP = &(X->child[1]))) != 0) ||\
03997         ((R = *(RP = &(X->child[0]))) != 0)) {\
03998       tchunkptr* CP;\
03999       while ((*(CP = &(R->child[1])) != 0) ||\
04000              (*(CP = &(R->child[0])) != 0)) {\
04001         R = *(RP = CP);\
04002       }\
04003       if (RTCHECK(ok_address(M, RP)))\
04004         *RP = 0;\
04005       else {\
04006         CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(M);\
04007       }\
04008     }\
04009   }\
04010   if (XP != 0) {\
04011     tbinptr* H = treebin_at(M, X->index);\
04012     if (X == *H) {\
04013       if ((*H = R) == 0) \
04014         clear_treemap(M, X->index);\
04015     }\
04016     else if (RTCHECK(ok_address(M, XP))) {\
04017       if (XP->child[0] == X) \
04018         XP->child[0] = R;\
04019       else \
04020         XP->child[1] = R;\
04021     }\
04022     else\
04023       CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(M);\
04024     if (R != 0) {\
04025       if (RTCHECK(ok_address(M, R))) {\
04026         tchunkptr C0, C1;\
04027         R->parent = XP;\
04028         if ((C0 = X->child[0]) != 0) {\
04029           if (RTCHECK(ok_address(M, C0))) {\
04030             R->child[0] = C0;\
04031             C0->parent = R;\
04032           }\
04033           else\
04034             CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(M);\
04035         }\
04036         if ((C1 = X->child[1]) != 0) {\
04037           if (RTCHECK(ok_address(M, C1))) {\
04038             R->child[1] = C1;\
04039             C1->parent = R;\
04040           }\
04041           else\
04042             CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(M);\
04043         }\
04044       }\
04045       else\
04046         CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(M);\
04047     }\
04048   }\
04049 }
04050 
04051 /* Relays to large vs small bin operations */
04052 
04053 #define insert_chunk(M, P, S)\
04054   if (is_small(S)) insert_small_chunk(M, P, S)\
04055   else { tchunkptr TP = (tchunkptr)(P); insert_large_chunk(M, TP, S); }
04056 
04057 #define unlink_chunk(M, P, S)\
04058   if (is_small(S)) unlink_small_chunk(M, P, S)\
04059   else { tchunkptr TP = (tchunkptr)(P); unlink_large_chunk(M, TP); }
04060 
04061 
04062 /* Relays to internal calls to malloc/free from realloc, memalign etc */
04063 #if ONLY_MSPACES
04064 static void* mspace_malloc_implementation(mstate ms, size_t bytes, unsigned flags);
04065 #define internal_malloc(m, b, f) mspace_malloc_implementation(m, b, f)
04066 #define internal_free(m, mem) mspace_free(m,mem);
04067 #else /* ONLY_MSPACES */
04068 #if MSPACES
04069 static void* mspace_malloc_implementation(mstate ms, size_t bytes, unsigned flags);
04070 #define internal_malloc(m, b, f)\
04071    (m == gm)? dlmalloc(b) : mspace_malloc_implementation(m, b, f)
04072 #define internal_free(m, mem)\
04073    if (m == gm) dlfree(mem); else mspace_free(m,mem);
04074 #else /* MSPACES */
04075 #define internal_malloc(m, b, f) dlmalloc(b)
04076 #define internal_free(m, mem) dlfree(mem)
04077 #endif /* MSPACES */
04078 #endif /* ONLY_MSPACES */
04079 
04080 /* -----------------------  Direct-mmapping chunks ----------------------- */
04081 
04082 /*
04083   Directly mmapped chunks are set up with an offset to the start of
04084   the mmapped region stored in the prev_foot field of the chunk. This
04085   allows reconstruction of the required argument to MUNMAP when freed,
04086   and also allows adjustment of the returned chunk to meet alignment
04087   requirements (especially in memalign).
04088 
04089   Directly mmapped chunks store a void* handle which can be used by
04090   the DIRECT_MMAP implementation to keep a per-chunk state. This
04091   handle is currently stored right at the front of the mmapped region,
04092   but do not rely on this - use the supplied parameter.
04093 */
04094 
04095 /* Malloc using mmap */
04096 static void* mmap_alloc(mstate m, size_t nb, unsigned flags) {
04097   size_t mmsize = mmap_align(nb + SEVEN_SIZE_T_SIZES + CHUNK_ALIGN_MASK);
04098   if (mmsize > nb) {     /* Check for wrap around 0 */
04099     void* mmaph = 0;
04100     char* mm = (char*)(CALL_DIRECT_MMAP(&mmaph, mmsize, flags));
04101     if (mm != CMFAIL) {
04102       size_t offset = MALLOC_ALIGNMENT + align_offset(chunk2mem(mm));
04103       size_t psize = mmsize - offset - MMAP_FOOT_PAD;
04104       mchunkptr p = (mchunkptr)(mm + offset);
04105       *(void**)mm = mmaph;
04106       p->prev_foot = offset;
04107       p->head = psize;
04108       mark_inuse_foot(m, p, psize);
04109       chunk_plus_offset(p, psize)->head = FENCEPOST_HEAD;
04110       chunk_plus_offset(p, psize+SIZE_T_SIZE)->head = 0;
04111 
04112       if (m->least_addr == 0 || mm < m->least_addr)
04113         m->least_addr = mm;
04114       if ((m->footprint += mmsize) > m->max_footprint)
04115         m->max_footprint = m->footprint;
04116       assert(is_aligned(chunk2mem(p)));
04117       check_mmapped_chunk(m, p);
04118       return chunk2mem(p);
04119     }
04120   }
04121   return 0;
04122 }
04123 
04124 /* Realloc using mmap */
04125 static mchunkptr mmap_resize(mstate m, mchunkptr oldp, size_t nb, unsigned flags) {
04126   size_t oldsize = chunksize(oldp);
04127   if (is_small(nb)) /* Can't shrink mmap regions below small size */
04128     return 0;
04129   /* Keep old chunk if big enough but not too big */
04130   if (oldsize >= nb + SIZE_T_SIZE &&
04131       (oldsize - nb) <= (mparams.granularity << 1))
04132     return oldp;
04133   else {
04134     size_t offset = oldp->prev_foot;
04135     size_t oldmmsize = oldsize + offset + MMAP_FOOT_PAD;
04136     size_t newmmsize = mmap_align(nb + SEVEN_SIZE_T_SIZES + CHUNK_ALIGN_MASK);
04137     char* mm = (char*)oldp - offset;
04138     void* mmaph = *(void**)mm;
04139         char* cp = (char*)CALL_DIRECT_MREMAP(&mmaph, mm, oldmmsize, newmmsize, (flags & M2_PREVENT_MOVE) ? 0 : MREMAP_MAYMOVE, flags);
04140     if (cp != CMFAIL) {
04141       mchunkptr newp = (mchunkptr)(cp + offset);
04142       size_t psize = newmmsize - offset - MMAP_FOOT_PAD;
04143       *(void**)cp = mmaph;
04144       newp->head = psize;
04145       mark_inuse_foot(m, newp, psize);
04146       chunk_plus_offset(newp, psize)->head = FENCEPOST_HEAD;
04147       chunk_plus_offset(newp, psize+SIZE_T_SIZE)->head = 0;
04148 
04149       if (cp < m->least_addr)
04150         m->least_addr = cp;
04151       if ((m->footprint += newmmsize - oldmmsize) > m->max_footprint)
04152         m->max_footprint = m->footprint;
04153       check_mmapped_chunk(m, newp);
04154       return newp;
04155     }
04156   }
04157   return 0;
04158 }
04159 
04160 /* -------------------------- mspace management -------------------------- */
04161 
04162 /* Initialize top chunk and its size */
04163 static void init_top(mstate m, mchunkptr p, size_t psize) {
04164   /* Ensure alignment */
04165   size_t offset = align_offset(chunk2mem(p));
04166   p = (mchunkptr)((char*)p + offset);
04167   psize -= offset;
04168 
04169   m->top = p;
04170   m->topsize = psize;
04171   p->head = psize | PINUSE_BIT;
04172   /* set size of fake trailing chunk holding overhead space only once */
04173   chunk_plus_offset(p, psize)->head = TOP_FOOT_SIZE;
04174   m->trim_check = mparams.trim_threshold; /* reset on each update */
04175 }
04176 
04177 /* Initialize bins for a new mstate that is otherwise zeroed out */
04178 static void init_bins(mstate m) {
04179   /* Establish circular links for smallbins */
04180   bindex_t i;
04181   for (i = 0; i < NSMALLBINS; ++i) {
04182     sbinptr bin = smallbin_at(m,i);
04183     bin->fd = bin->bk = bin;
04184   }
04185 }
04186 
04187 #if PROCEED_ON_ERROR
04188 
04189 /* default corruption action */
04190 static void reset_on_error(mstate m) {
04191   int i;
04192   ++malloc_corruption_error_count;
04193   /* Reinitialize fields to forget about all memory */
04194   m->smallbins = m->treebins = 0;
04195   m->dvsize = m->topsize = 0;
04196   m->seg.base = 0;
04197   m->seg.size = 0;
04198   m->seg.next = 0;
04199   m->top = m->dv = 0;
04200   for (i = 0; i < NTREEBINS; ++i)
04201     *treebin_at(m, i) = 0;
04202   init_bins(m);
04203 }
04204 #endif /* PROCEED_ON_ERROR */
04205 
04206 /* Allocate chunk and prepend remainder with chunk in successor base. */
04207 static void* prepend_alloc(mstate m, char* newbase, char* oldbase,
04208                            size_t nb) {
04209   mchunkptr p = align_as_chunk(newbase);
04210   mchunkptr oldfirst = align_as_chunk(oldbase);
04211   size_t psize = (char*)oldfirst - (char*)p;
04212   mchunkptr q = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
04213   size_t qsize = psize - nb;
04214   set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(m, p, nb);
04215 
04216   assert((char*)oldfirst > (char*)q);
04217   assert(pinuse(oldfirst));
04218   assert(qsize >= MIN_CHUNK_SIZE);
04219 
04220   /* consolidate remainder with first chunk of old base */
04221   if (oldfirst == m->top) {
04222     size_t tsize = m->topsize += qsize;
04223     m->top = q;
04224     q->head = tsize | PINUSE_BIT;
04225     check_top_chunk(m, q);
04226   }
04227   else if (oldfirst == m->dv) {
04228     size_t dsize = m->dvsize += qsize;
04229     m->dv = q;
04230     set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(q, dsize);
04231   }
04232   else {
04233     if (!is_inuse(oldfirst)) {
04234       size_t nsize = chunksize(oldfirst);
04235       unlink_chunk(m, oldfirst, nsize);
04236       oldfirst = chunk_plus_offset(oldfirst, nsize);
04237       qsize += nsize;
04238     }
04239     set_free_with_pinuse(q, qsize, oldfirst);
04240     insert_chunk(m, q, qsize);
04241     check_free_chunk(m, q);
04242   }
04243 
04244   check_malloced_chunk(m, chunk2mem(p), nb);
04245   return chunk2mem(p);
04246 }
04247 
04248 /* Add a segment to hold a new noncontiguous region */
04249 static void add_segment(mstate m, char* tbase, size_t tsize, flag_t mmapped) {
04250   /* Determine locations and sizes of segment, fenceposts, old top */
04251   char* old_top = (char*)m->top;
04252   msegmentptr oldsp = segment_holding(m, old_top);
04253   char* old_end = oldsp->base + oldsp->size;
04254   size_t ssize = pad_request(sizeof(struct malloc_segment));
04255   char* rawsp = old_end - (ssize + FOUR_SIZE_T_SIZES + CHUNK_ALIGN_MASK);
04256   size_t offset = align_offset(chunk2mem(rawsp));
04257   char* asp = rawsp + offset;
04258   char* csp = (asp < (old_top + MIN_CHUNK_SIZE))? old_top : asp;
04259   mchunkptr sp = (mchunkptr)csp;
04260   msegmentptr ss = (msegmentptr)(chunk2mem(sp));
04261   mchunkptr tnext = chunk_plus_offset(sp, ssize);
04262   mchunkptr p = tnext;
04263   int nfences = 0;
04264 
04265   /* reset top to new space */
04266   init_top(m, (mchunkptr)tbase, tsize - TOP_FOOT_SIZE);
04267 
04268   /* Set up segment record */
04269   assert(is_aligned(ss));
04270   set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(m, sp, ssize);
04271   *ss = m->seg; /* Push current record */
04272   m->seg.base = tbase;
04273   m->seg.size = tsize;
04274   m->seg.sflags = mmapped;
04275   m->seg.next = ss;
04276 
04277   /* Insert trailing fenceposts */
04278   for (;;) {
04279     mchunkptr nextp = chunk_plus_offset(p, SIZE_T_SIZE);
04280     p->head = FENCEPOST_HEAD;
04281     ++nfences;
04282     if ((char*)(&(nextp->head)) < old_end)
04283       p = nextp;
04284     else
04285       break;
04286   }
04287   assert(nfences >= 2);
04288 
04289   /* Insert the rest of old top into a bin as an ordinary free chunk */
04290   if (csp != old_top) {
04291     mchunkptr q = (mchunkptr)old_top;
04292     size_t psize = csp - old_top;
04293     mchunkptr tn = chunk_plus_offset(q, psize);
04294     set_free_with_pinuse(q, psize, tn);
04295     insert_chunk(m, q, psize);
04296   }
04297 
04298   check_top_chunk(m, m->top);
04299 }
04300 
04301 /* -------------------------- System allocation -------------------------- */
04302 
04303 /* Get memory from system using MORECORE or MMAP */
04304 static void* sys_alloc(mstate m, size_t nb, unsigned flags) {
04305   char* tbase = CMFAIL;
04306   size_t tsize = 0;
04307   flag_t mmap_flag = 0;
04308 
04309   ensure_initialization();
04310 
04311   /* Directly map large chunks, but only if already initialized */
04312   if (use_mmap(m) && (nb >= mparams.mmap_threshold || (flags & M2_ALWAYS_MMAP)) && m->topsize != 0) {
04313     void* mem = mmap_alloc(m, nb, flags);
04314     if (mem != 0 || (flags & M2_ALWAYS_MMAP))
04315       return mem;
04316   }
04317 
04318   /*
04319     Try getting memory in any of three ways (in most-preferred to
04320     least-preferred order):
04321     1. A call to MORECORE that can normally contiguously extend memory.
04322        (disabled if not MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS or not HAVE_MORECORE or
04323        or main space is mmapped or a previous contiguous call failed)
04324     2. A call to MMAP new space (disabled if not HAVE_MMAP).
04325        Note that under the default settings, if MORECORE is unable to
04326        fulfill a request, and HAVE_MMAP is true, then mmap is
04327        used as a noncontiguous system allocator. This is a useful backup
04328        strategy for systems with holes in address spaces -- in this case
04329        sbrk cannot contiguously expand the heap, but mmap may be able to
04330        find space.
04331     3. A call to MORECORE that cannot usually contiguously extend memory.
04332        (disabled if not HAVE_MORECORE)
04333 
04334    In all cases, we need to request enough bytes from system to ensure
04335    we can malloc nb bytes upon success, so pad with enough space for
04336    top_foot, plus alignment-pad to make sure we don't lose bytes if
04337    not on boundary, and round this up to a granularity unit.
04338   */
04339 
04340   if (MORECORE_CONTIGUOUS && !use_noncontiguous(m)) {
04341     char* br = CMFAIL;
04342     msegmentptr ss = (m->top == 0)? 0 : segment_holding(m, (char*)m->top);
04343     size_t asize = 0;
04344     ACQUIRE_MALLOC_GLOBAL_LOCK();
04345 
04346     if (ss == 0) {  /* First time through or recovery */
04347       char* base = (char*)CALL_MORECORE(0);
04348       if (base != CMFAIL) {
04349         asize = granularity_align(nb + SYS_ALLOC_PADDING);
04350         /* Adjust to end on a page boundary */
04351         if (!is_page_aligned(base))
04352           asize += (page_align((size_t)base) - (size_t)base);
04353         /* Can't call MORECORE if size is negative when treated as signed */
04354         if (asize < HALF_MAX_SIZE_T &&
04355             (br = (char*)(CALL_MORECORE(asize))) == base) {
04356           tbase = base;
04357           tsize = asize;
04358         }
04359       }
04360     }
04361     else {
04362       /* Subtract out existing available top space from MORECORE request. */
04363       asize = granularity_align(nb - m->topsize + SYS_ALLOC_PADDING);
04364       /* Use mem here only if it did continuously extend old space */
04365       if (asize < HALF_MAX_SIZE_T &&
04366           (br = (char*)(CALL_MORECORE(asize))) == ss->base+ss->size) {
04367         tbase = br;
04368         tsize = asize;
04369       }
04370     }
04371 
04372     if (tbase == CMFAIL) {    /* Cope with partial failure */
04373       if (br != CMFAIL) {    /* Try to use/extend the space we did get */
04374         if (asize < HALF_MAX_SIZE_T &&
04375             asize < nb + SYS_ALLOC_PADDING) {
04376           size_t esize = granularity_align(nb + SYS_ALLOC_PADDING - asize);
04377           if (esize < HALF_MAX_SIZE_T) {
04378             char* end = (char*)CALL_MORECORE(esize);
04379             if (end != CMFAIL)
04380               asize += esize;
04381             else {            /* Can't use; try to release */
04382               (void) CALL_MORECORE(-asize);
04383               br = CMFAIL;
04384             }
04385           }
04386         }
04387       }
04388       if (br != CMFAIL) {    /* Use the space we did get */
04389         tbase = br;
04390         tsize = asize;
04391       }
04392       else
04393         disable_contiguous(m); /* Don't try contiguous path in the future */
04394     }
04395 
04396     RELEASE_MALLOC_GLOBAL_LOCK();
04397   }
04398 
04399   if (HAVE_MMAP && tbase == CMFAIL) {  /* Try MMAP */
04400     size_t rsize = granularity_align(nb + SYS_ALLOC_PADDING);
04401     if (rsize > nb) { /* Fail if wraps around zero */
04402       char* mp = (char*)(CALL_MMAP(rsize, flags));
04403       if (mp != CMFAIL) {
04404         tbase = mp;
04405         tsize = rsize;
04406         mmap_flag = USE_MMAP_BIT;
04407       }
04408     }
04409   }
04410 
04411   if (HAVE_MORECORE && tbase == CMFAIL) { /* Try noncontiguous MORECORE */
04412     size_t asize = granularity_align(nb + SYS_ALLOC_PADDING);
04413     if (asize < HALF_MAX_SIZE_T) {
04414       char* br = CMFAIL;
04415       char* end = CMFAIL;
04416       ACQUIRE_MALLOC_GLOBAL_LOCK();
04417       br = (char*)(CALL_MORECORE(asize));
04418       end = (char*)(CALL_MORECORE(0));
04419       RELEASE_MALLOC_GLOBAL_LOCK();
04420       if (br != CMFAIL && end != CMFAIL && br < end) {
04421         size_t ssize = end - br;
04422         if (ssize > nb + TOP_FOOT_SIZE) {
04423           tbase = br;
04424           tsize = ssize;
04425         }
04426       }
04427     }
04428   }
04429 
04430   if (tbase != CMFAIL) {
04431 
04432     if ((m->footprint += tsize) > m->max_footprint)
04433       m->max_footprint = m->footprint;
04434 
04435     if (!is_initialized(m)) { /* first-time initialization */
04436       if (m->least_addr == 0 || tbase < m->least_addr)
04437         m->least_addr = tbase;
04438       m->seg.base = tbase;
04439       m->seg.size = tsize;
04440       m->seg.sflags = mmap_flag;
04441       m->magic = mparams.magic;
04442       m->release_checks = MAX_RELEASE_CHECK_RATE;
04443       init_bins(m);
04444 #if !ONLY_MSPACES
04445       if (is_global(m))
04446         init_top(m, (mchunkptr)tbase, tsize - TOP_FOOT_SIZE);
04447       else
04448 #endif
04449       {
04450         /* Offset top by embedded malloc_state */
04451         mchunkptr mn = next_chunk(mem2chunk(m));
04452         init_top(m, mn, (size_t)((tbase + tsize) - (char*)mn) -TOP_FOOT_SIZE);
04453       }
04454     }
04455 
04456     else {
04457       /* Try to merge with an existing segment */
04458       msegmentptr sp = &m->seg;
04459       /* Only consider most recent segment if traversal suppressed */
04460       while (sp != 0 && tbase != sp->base + sp->size)
04461         sp = (NO_SEGMENT_TRAVERSAL) ? 0 : sp->next;
04462       if (sp != 0 &&
04463           !is_extern_segment(sp) &&
04464           (sp->sflags & USE_MMAP_BIT) == mmap_flag &&
04465           segment_holds(sp, m->top)) { /* append */
04466         sp->size += tsize;
04467         init_top(m, m->top, m->topsize + tsize);
04468       }
04469       else {
04470         if (tbase < m->least_addr)
04471           m->least_addr = tbase;
04472         sp = &m->seg;
04473         while (sp != 0 && sp->base != tbase + tsize)
04474           sp = (NO_SEGMENT_TRAVERSAL) ? 0 : sp->next;
04475         if (sp != 0 &&
04476             !is_extern_segment(sp) &&
04477             (sp->sflags & USE_MMAP_BIT) == mmap_flag) {
04478           char* oldbase = sp->base;
04479           sp->base = tbase;
04480           sp->size += tsize;
04481           return prepend_alloc(m, tbase, oldbase, nb);
04482         }
04483         else
04484           add_segment(m, tbase, tsize, mmap_flag);
04485       }
04486     }
04487 
04488     if (nb < m->topsize) { /* Allocate from new or extended top space */
04489       size_t rsize = m->topsize -= nb;
04490       mchunkptr p = m->top;
04491       mchunkptr r = m->top = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
04492       r->head = rsize | PINUSE_BIT;
04493       set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(m, p, nb);
04494       check_top_chunk(m, m->top);
04495       check_malloced_chunk(m, chunk2mem(p), nb);
04496       return chunk2mem(p);
04497     }
04498   }
04499 
04500   MALLOC_FAILURE_ACTION;
04501   return 0;
04502 }
04503 
04504 /* -----------------------  system deallocation -------------------------- */
04505 
04506 /* Unmap and unlink any mmapped segments that don't contain used chunks */
04507 static size_t release_unused_segments(mstate m) {
04508   size_t released = 0;
04509   int nsegs = 0;
04510   msegmentptr pred = &m->seg;
04511   msegmentptr sp = pred->next;
04512   while (sp != 0) {
04513     char* base = sp->base;
04514     size_t size = sp->size;
04515     msegmentptr next = sp->next;
04516     ++nsegs;
04517     if (is_mmapped_segment(sp) && !is_extern_segment(sp)) {
04518       mchunkptr p = align_as_chunk(base);
04519       size_t psize = chunksize(p);
04520       /* Can unmap if first chunk holds entire segment and not pinned */
04521       if (!is_inuse(p) && (char*)p + psize >= base + size - TOP_FOOT_SIZE) {
04522         tchunkptr tp = (tchunkptr)p;
04523         assert(segment_holds(sp, (char*)sp));
04524         if (p == m->dv) {
04525           m->dv = 0;
04526           m->dvsize = 0;
04527         }
04528         else {
04529           unlink_large_chunk(m, tp);
04530         }
04531         if (CALL_MUNMAP(0/*segment*/, base, size) == 0) {
04532           released += size;
04533           m->footprint -= size;
04534           /* unlink obsoleted record */
04535           sp = pred;
04536           sp->next = next;
04537         }
04538         else { /* back out if cannot unmap */
04539           insert_large_chunk(m, tp, psize);
04540         }
04541       }
04542     }
04543     if (NO_SEGMENT_TRAVERSAL) /* scan only first segment */
04544       break;
04545     pred = sp;
04546     sp = next;
04547   }
04548   /* Reset check counter */
04549   m->release_checks = ((nsegs > MAX_RELEASE_CHECK_RATE)?
04550                        nsegs : MAX_RELEASE_CHECK_RATE);
04551   return released;
04552 }
04553 
04554 static int sys_trim(mstate m, size_t pad) {
04555   size_t released = 0;
04556   ensure_initialization();
04557   if (pad < MAX_REQUEST && is_initialized(m)) {
04558     pad += TOP_FOOT_SIZE; /* ensure enough room for segment overhead */
04559 
04560     if (m->topsize > pad) {
04561       /* Shrink top space in granularity-size units, keeping at least one */
04562       size_t unit = mparams.granularity;
04563       size_t extra = ((m->topsize - pad + (unit - SIZE_T_ONE)) / unit -
04564                       SIZE_T_ONE) * unit;
04565       msegmentptr sp = segment_holding(m, (char*)m->top);
04566 
04567       if (!is_extern_segment(sp)) {
04568         if (is_mmapped_segment(sp)) {
04569           if (HAVE_MMAP &&
04570               sp->size >= extra &&
04571               !has_segment_link(m, sp)) { /* can't shrink if pinned */
04572             size_t newsize = sp->size - extra;
04573             /* Prefer mremap, fall back to munmap */
04574             if ((CALL_MREMAP(sp->base, sp->size, newsize, 0) != MFAIL) ||
04575                 (CALL_MUNMAP(0/*segment*/, sp->base + newsize, extra) == 0)) {
04576               released = extra;
04577             }
04578           }
04579         }
04580         else if (HAVE_MORECORE) {
04581           if (extra >= HALF_MAX_SIZE_T) /* Avoid wrapping negative */
04582             extra = (HALF_MAX_SIZE_T) + SIZE_T_ONE - unit;
04583           ACQUIRE_MALLOC_GLOBAL_LOCK();
04584           {
04585             /* Make sure end of memory is where we last set it. */
04586             char* old_br = (char*)(CALL_MORECORE(0));
04587             if (old_br == sp->base + sp->size) {
04588               char* rel_br = (char*)(CALL_MORECORE(-extra));
04589               char* new_br = (char*)(CALL_MORECORE(0));
04590               if (rel_br != CMFAIL && new_br < old_br)
04591                 released = old_br - new_br;
04592             }
04593           }
04594           RELEASE_MALLOC_GLOBAL_LOCK();
04595         }
04596       }
04597 
04598       if (released != 0) {
04599         sp->size -= released;
04600         m->footprint -= released;
04601         init_top(m, m->top, m->topsize - released);
04602         check_top_chunk(m, m->top);
04603       }
04604     }
04605 
04606     /* Unmap any unused mmapped segments */
04607     if (HAVE_MMAP)
04608       released += release_unused_segments(m);
04609 
04610     /* On failure, disable autotrim to avoid repeated failed future calls */
04611     if (released == 0 && m->topsize > m->trim_check)
04612       m->trim_check = MAX_SIZE_T;
04613   }
04614 
04615   return (released != 0)? 1 : 0;
04616 }
04617 
04618 
04619 /* ---------------------------- malloc support --------------------------- */
04620 
04621 /* allocate a large request from the best fitting chunk in a treebin */
04622 static void* tmalloc_large(mstate m, size_t nb) {
04623   tchunkptr v = 0;
04624   size_t rsize = -nb; /* Unsigned negation */
04625   tchunkptr t;
04626   bindex_t idx;
04627   compute_tree_index(nb, idx);
04628   if ((t = *treebin_at(m, idx)) != 0) {
04629     /* Traverse tree for this bin looking for node with size == nb */
04630     size_t sizebits = nb << leftshift_for_tree_index(idx);
04631     tchunkptr rst = 0;  /* The deepest untaken right subtree */
04632     for (;;) {
04633       tchunkptr rt;
04634       size_t trem = chunksize(t) - nb;
04635       if (trem < rsize) {
04636         v = t;
04637         if ((rsize = trem) == 0)
04638           break;
04639       }
04640       rt = t->child[1];
04641       t = t->child[(sizebits >> (SIZE_T_BITSIZE-SIZE_T_ONE)) & 1];
04642       if (rt != 0 && rt != t)
04643         rst = rt;
04644       if (t == 0) {
04645         t = rst; /* set t to least subtree holding sizes > nb */
04646         break;
04647       }
04648       sizebits <<= 1;
04649     }
04650   }
04651   if (t == 0 && v == 0) { /* set t to root of next non-empty treebin */
04652     binmap_t leftbits = left_bits(idx2bit(idx)) & m->treemap;
04653     if (leftbits != 0) {
04654       bindex_t i;
04655       binmap_t leastbit = least_bit(leftbits);
04656       compute_bit2idx(leastbit, i);
04657       t = *treebin_at(m, i);
04658     }
04659   }
04660 
04661   while (t != 0) { /* find smallest of tree or subtree */
04662     size_t trem = chunksize(t) - nb;
04663     if (trem < rsize) {
04664       rsize = trem;
04665       v = t;
04666     }
04667     t = leftmost_child(t);
04668   }
04669 
04670   /*  If dv is a better fit, return 0 so malloc will use it */
04671   if (v != 0 && rsize < (size_t)(m->dvsize - nb)) {
04672     if (RTCHECK(ok_address(m, v))) { /* split */
04673       mchunkptr r = chunk_plus_offset(v, nb);
04674       assert(chunksize(v) == rsize + nb);
04675       if (RTCHECK(ok_next(v, r))) {
04676         unlink_large_chunk(m, v);
04677         if (rsize < MIN_CHUNK_SIZE)
04678           set_inuse_and_pinuse(m, v, (rsize + nb));
04679         else {
04680           set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(m, v, nb);
04681           set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(r, rsize);
04682           insert_chunk(m, r, rsize);
04683         }
04684         return chunk2mem(v);
04685       }
04686     }
04687     CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(m);
04688   }
04689   return 0;
04690 }
04691 
04692 /* allocate a small request from the best fitting chunk in a treebin */
04693 static void* tmalloc_small(mstate m, size_t nb) {
04694   tchunkptr t, v;
04695   size_t rsize;
04696   bindex_t i;
04697   binmap_t leastbit = least_bit(m->treemap);
04698   compute_bit2idx(leastbit, i);
04699   v = t = *treebin_at(m, i);
04700   rsize = chunksize(t) - nb;
04701 
04702   while ((t = leftmost_child(t)) != 0) {
04703     size_t trem = chunksize(t) - nb;
04704     if (trem < rsize) {
04705       rsize = trem;
04706       v = t;
04707     }
04708   }
04709 
04710   if (RTCHECK(ok_address(m, v))) {
04711     mchunkptr r = chunk_plus_offset(v, nb);
04712     assert(chunksize(v) == rsize + nb);
04713     if (RTCHECK(ok_next(v, r))) {
04714       unlink_large_chunk(m, v);
04715       if (rsize < MIN_CHUNK_SIZE)
04716         set_inuse_and_pinuse(m, v, (rsize + nb));
04717       else {
04718         set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(m, v, nb);
04719         set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(r, rsize);
04720         replace_dv(m, r, rsize);
04721       }
04722       return chunk2mem(v);
04723     }
04724   }
04725 
04726   CORRUPTION_ERROR_ACTION(m);
04727   return 0;
04728 }
04729 
04730 /* --------------------------- realloc support --------------------------- */
04731 static void* internal_memalign(mstate m, size_t alignment, size_t bytes, unsigned flags);
04732 
04733 static void* internal_realloc(mstate m, void* oldmem, size_t bytes, size_t alignment, unsigned flags) {
04734   if (bytes >= MAX_REQUEST) {
04735     MALLOC_FAILURE_ACTION;
04736     return 0;
04737   }
04738   if (!PREACTION(m)) {
04739     mchunkptr oldp = mem2chunk(oldmem);
04740     size_t oldsize = chunksize(oldp);
04741     mchunkptr next = chunk_plus_offset(oldp, oldsize);
04742     mchunkptr newp = 0;
04743     void* extra = 0;
04744 
04745     /* Try to either shrink or extend into top. Else malloc-copy-free */
04746 
04747     if (RTCHECK(ok_address(m, oldp) && ok_inuse(oldp) &&
04748                 ok_next(oldp, next) && ok_pinuse(next))) {
04749       size_t nb = request2size(bytes);
04750       if (is_mmapped(oldp))
04751         newp = mmap_resize(m, oldp, nb, flags);
04752       else if (oldsize >= nb) { /* already big enough */
04753         size_t rsize = oldsize - nb;
04754         newp = oldp;
04755         if (rsize >= MIN_CHUNK_SIZE) {
04756           mchunkptr remainder = chunk_plus_offset(newp, nb);
04757           set_inuse(m, newp, nb);
04758           set_inuse_and_pinuse(m, remainder, rsize);
04759           extra = chunk2mem(remainder);
04760         }
04761       }
04762       else if (next == m->top && oldsize + m->topsize > nb) {
04763         /* Expand into top */
04764         size_t newsize = oldsize + m->topsize;
04765         size_t newtopsize = newsize - nb;
04766         mchunkptr newtop = chunk_plus_offset(oldp, nb);
04767         set_inuse(m, oldp, nb);
04768         newtop->head = newtopsize |PINUSE_BIT;
04769         m->top = newtop;
04770         m->topsize = newtopsize;
04771         newp = oldp;
04772       }
04773     }
04774     else {
04775       USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(m, oldmem);
04776       POSTACTION(m);
04777       return 0;
04778     }
04779 #if DEBUG
04780     if (newp != 0) {
04781       check_inuse_chunk(m, newp); /* Check requires lock */
04782     }
04783 #endif
04784 
04785     POSTACTION(m);
04786 
04787     if (newp != 0) {
04788       if (extra != 0) {
04789         internal_free(m, extra);
04790       }
04791       return chunk2mem(newp);
04792     }
04793     else if (!(flags & M2_PREVENT_MOVE)) {
04794       void* newmem = (alignment > MALLOC_ALIGNMENT) ?
04795         internal_memalign(m, alignment, bytes, flags)
04796         : internal_malloc(m, bytes, flags);
04797       if (newmem != 0) {
04798         size_t oc = oldsize - overhead_for(oldp);
04799         memcpy(newmem, oldmem, (oc < bytes)? oc : bytes);
04800         internal_free(m, oldmem);
04801       }
04802       return newmem;
04803     }
04804   }
04805   return 0;
04806 }
04807 
04808 /* --------------------------- memalign support -------------------------- */
04809 
04810 static void* internal_memalign(mstate m, size_t alignment, size_t bytes, unsigned flags) {
04811   if (alignment <= MALLOC_ALIGNMENT)    /* Can just use malloc */
04812     return internal_malloc(m, bytes, flags);
04813   if (alignment <  MIN_CHUNK_SIZE) /* must be at least a minimum chunk size */
04814     alignment = MIN_CHUNK_SIZE;
04815   if ((alignment & (alignment-SIZE_T_ONE)) != 0) {/* Ensure a power of 2 */
04816     size_t a = MALLOC_ALIGNMENT << 1;
04817     while (a < alignment) a <<= 1;
04818     alignment = a;
04819   }
04820 
04821   if (bytes >= MAX_REQUEST - alignment) {
04822     if (m != 0)  { /* Test isn't needed but avoids compiler warning */
04823       MALLOC_FAILURE_ACTION;
04824     }
04825   }
04826   else {
04827     size_t nb = request2size(bytes);
04828     size_t req = nb + alignment + MIN_CHUNK_SIZE - CHUNK_OVERHEAD;
04829     char* mem = (char*)internal_malloc(m, req, flags);
04830     if (mem != 0) {
04831       void* leader = 0;
04832       void* trailer = 0;
04833       mchunkptr p = mem2chunk(mem);
04834 
04835       if (PREACTION(m)) return 0;
04836       if ((((size_t)(mem)) % alignment) != 0) { /* misaligned */
04837         /*
04838           Find an aligned spot inside chunk.  Since we need to give
04839           back leading space in a chunk of at least MIN_CHUNK_SIZE, if
04840           the first calculation places us at a spot with less than
04841           MIN_CHUNK_SIZE leader, we can move to the next aligned spot.
04842           We've allocated enough total room so that this is always
04843           possible.
04844         */
04845         char* br = (char*)mem2chunk((size_t)(((size_t)(mem +
04846                                                        alignment -
04847                                                        SIZE_T_ONE)) &
04848                                              -alignment));
04849         char* pos = ((size_t)(br - (char*)(p)) >= MIN_CHUNK_SIZE)?
04850           br : br+alignment;
04851         mchunkptr newp = (mchunkptr)pos;
04852         size_t leadsize = pos - (char*)(p);
04853         size_t newsize = chunksize(p) - leadsize;
04854 
04855         if (is_mmapped(p)) { /* For mmapped chunks, just adjust offset */
04856           newp->prev_foot = p->prev_foot + leadsize;
04857           newp->head = newsize;
04858         }
04859         else { /* Otherwise, give back leader, use the rest */
04860           set_inuse(m, newp, newsize);
04861           set_inuse(m, p, leadsize);
04862           leader = chunk2mem(p);
04863         }
04864         p = newp;
04865       }
04866 
04867       /* Give back spare room at the end */
04868       if (!is_mmapped(p)) {
04869         size_t size = chunksize(p);
04870         if (size > nb + MIN_CHUNK_SIZE) {
04871           size_t remainder_size = size - nb;
04872           mchunkptr remainder = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
04873           set_inuse(m, p, nb);
04874           set_inuse(m, remainder, remainder_size);
04875           trailer = chunk2mem(remainder);
04876         }
04877       }
04878 
04879       assert (chunksize(p) >= nb);
04880       assert((((size_t)(chunk2mem(p))) % alignment) == 0);
04881       check_inuse_chunk(m, p);
04882       POSTACTION(m);
04883       if (leader != 0) {
04884         internal_free(m, leader);
04885       }
04886       if (trailer != 0) {
04887         internal_free(m, trailer);
04888       }
04889       return chunk2mem(p);
04890     }
04891   }
04892   return 0;
04893 }
04894 
04895 /* ------------------------ comalloc/coalloc support --------------------- */
04896 
04897 static void** ialloc(mstate m,
04898                      size_t n_elements,
04899                      size_t* sizes,
04900                      int opts,
04901                      void* chunks[]) {
04902   /*
04903     This provides common support for independent_X routines, handling
04904     all of the combinations that can result.
04905 
04906     The opts arg has:
04907     bit 0 set if all elements are same size (using sizes[0])
04908     bit 1 set if elements should be zeroed
04909   */
04910 
04911   size_t    element_size;   /* chunksize of each element, if all same */
04912   size_t    contents_size;  /* total size of elements */
04913   size_t    array_size;     /* request size of pointer array */
04914   void*     mem;            /* malloced aggregate space */
04915   mchunkptr p;              /* corresponding chunk */
04916   size_t    remainder_size; /* remaining bytes while splitting */
04917   void**    marray;         /* either "chunks" or malloced ptr array */
04918   mchunkptr array_chunk;    /* chunk for malloced ptr array */
04919   flag_t    was_enabled;    /* to disable mmap */
04920   size_t    size;
04921   size_t    i;
04922 
04923   ensure_initialization();
04924   /* compute array length, if needed */
04925   if (chunks != 0) {
04926     if (n_elements == 0)
04927       return chunks; /* nothing to do */
04928     marray = chunks;
04929     array_size = 0;
04930   }
04931   else {
04932     /* if empty req, must still return chunk representing empty array */
04933     if (n_elements == 0)
04934       return (void**)internal_malloc(m, 0, 0);
04935     marray = 0;
04936     array_size = request2size(n_elements * (sizeof(void*)));
04937   }
04938 
04939   /* compute total element size */
04940   if (opts & 0x1) { /* all-same-size */
04941     element_size = request2size(*sizes);
04942     contents_size = n_elements * element_size;
04943   }
04944   else { /* add up all the sizes */
04945     element_size = 0;
04946     contents_size = 0;
04947     for (i = 0; i != n_elements; ++i)
04948       contents_size += request2size(sizes[i]);
04949   }
04950 
04951   size = contents_size + array_size;
04952 
04953   /*
04954      Allocate the aggregate chunk.  First disable direct-mmapping so
04955      malloc won't use it, since we would not be able to later
04956      free/realloc space internal to a segregated mmap region.
04957   */
04958   was_enabled = use_mmap(m);
04959   disable_mmap(m);
04960   mem = internal_malloc(m, size - CHUNK_OVERHEAD, 0);
04961   if (was_enabled)
04962     enable_mmap(m);
04963   if (mem == 0)
04964     return 0;
04965 
04966   if (PREACTION(m)) return 0;
04967   p = mem2chunk(mem);
04968   remainder_size = chunksize(p);
04969 
04970   assert(!is_mmapped(p));
04971 
04972   if (opts & 0x2) {       /* optionally clear the elements */
04973     memset((size_t*)mem, 0, remainder_size - SIZE_T_SIZE - array_size);
04974   }
04975 
04976   /* If not provided, allocate the pointer array as final part of chunk */
04977   if (marray == 0) {
04978     size_t  array_chunk_size;
04979     array_chunk = chunk_plus_offset(p, contents_size);
04980     array_chunk_size = remainder_size - contents_size;
04981     marray = (void**) (chunk2mem(array_chunk));
04982     set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(m, array_chunk, array_chunk_size);
04983     remainder_size = contents_size;
04984   }
04985 
04986   /* split out elements */
04987   for (i = 0; ; ++i) {
04988     marray[i] = chunk2mem(p);
04989     if (i != n_elements-1) {
04990       if (element_size != 0)
04991         size = element_size;
04992       else
04993         size = request2size(sizes[i]);
04994       remainder_size -= size;
04995       set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(m, p, size);
04996       p = chunk_plus_offset(p, size);
04997     }
04998     else { /* the final element absorbs any overallocation slop */
04999       set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(m, p, remainder_size);
05000       break;
05001     }
05002   }
05003 
05004 #if DEBUG
05005   if (marray != chunks) {
05006     /* final element must have exactly exhausted chunk */
05007     if (element_size != 0) {
05008       assert(remainder_size == element_size);
05009     }
05010     else {
05011       assert(remainder_size == request2size(sizes[i]));
05012     }
05013     check_inuse_chunk(m, mem2chunk(marray));
05014   }
05015   for (i = 0; i != n_elements; ++i)
05016     check_inuse_chunk(m, mem2chunk(marray[i]));
05017 
05018 #endif /* DEBUG */
05019 
05020   POSTACTION(m);
05021   return marray;
05022 }
05023 
05024 
05025 /* -------------------------- public routines ---------------------------- */
05026 
05027 #if !ONLY_MSPACES
05028 
05029 void* dlmalloc(size_t bytes) {
05030   /*
05031      Basic algorithm:
05032      If a small request (< 256 bytes minus per-chunk overhead):
05033        1. If one exists, use a remainderless chunk in associated smallbin.
05034           (Remainderless means that there are too few excess bytes to
05035           represent as a chunk.)
05036        2. If it is big enough, use the dv chunk, which is normally the
05037           chunk adjacent to the one used for the most recent small request.
05038        3. If one exists, split the smallest available chunk in a bin,
05039           saving remainder in dv.
05040        4. If it is big enough, use the top chunk.
05041        5. If available, get memory from system and use it
05042      Otherwise, for a large request:
05043        1. Find the smallest available binned chunk that fits, and use it
05044           if it is better fitting than dv chunk, splitting if necessary.
05045        2. If better fitting than any binned chunk, use the dv chunk.
05046        3. If it is big enough, use the top chunk.
05047        4. If request size >= mmap threshold, try to directly mmap this chunk.
05048        5. If available, get memory from system and use it
05049 
05050      The ugly goto's here ensure that postaction occurs along all paths.
05051   */
05052 
05053 #if USE_LOCKS
05054   ensure_initialization(); /* initialize in sys_alloc if not using locks */
05055 #endif
05056 
05057   if (!PREACTION(gm)) {
05058     void* mem;
05059     size_t nb;
05060     if (bytes <= MAX_SMALL_REQUEST) {
05061       bindex_t idx;
05062       binmap_t smallbits;
05063       nb = (bytes < MIN_REQUEST)? MIN_CHUNK_SIZE : pad_request(bytes);
05064       idx = small_index(nb);
05065       smallbits = gm->smallmap >> idx;
05066 
05067       if ((smallbits & 0x3U) != 0) { /* Remainderless fit to a smallbin. */
05068         mchunkptr b, p;
05069         idx += ~smallbits & 1;       /* Uses next bin if idx empty */
05070         b = smallbin_at(gm, idx);
05071         p = b->fd;
05072         assert(chunksize(p) == small_index2size(idx));
05073         unlink_first_small_chunk(gm, b, p, idx);
05074         set_inuse_and_pinuse(gm, p, small_index2size(idx));
05075         mem = chunk2mem(p);
05076         check_malloced_chunk(gm, mem, nb);
05077         goto postaction;
05078       }
05079 
05080       else if (nb > gm->dvsize) {
05081         if (smallbits != 0) { /* Use chunk in next nonempty smallbin */
05082           mchunkptr b, p, r;
05083           size_t rsize;
05084           bindex_t i;
05085           binmap_t leftbits = (smallbits << idx) & left_bits(idx2bit(idx));
05086           binmap_t leastbit = least_bit(leftbits);
05087           compute_bit2idx(leastbit, i);
05088           b = smallbin_at(gm, i);
05089           p = b->fd;
05090           assert(chunksize(p) == small_index2size(i));
05091           unlink_first_small_chunk(gm, b, p, i);
05092           rsize = small_index2size(i) - nb;
05093           /* Fit here cannot be remainderless if 4byte sizes */
05094           if (SIZE_T_SIZE != 4 && rsize < MIN_CHUNK_SIZE)
05095             set_inuse_and_pinuse(gm, p, small_index2size(i));
05096           else {
05097             set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(gm, p, nb);
05098             r = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
05099             set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(r, rsize);
05100             replace_dv(gm, r, rsize);
05101           }
05102           mem = chunk2mem(p);
05103           check_malloced_chunk(gm, mem, nb);
05104           goto postaction;
05105         }
05106 
05107         else if (gm->treemap != 0 && (mem = tmalloc_small(gm, nb)) != 0) {
05108           check_malloced_chunk(gm, mem, nb);
05109           goto postaction;
05110         }
05111       }
05112     }
05113     else if (bytes >= MAX_REQUEST)
05114       nb = MAX_SIZE_T; /* Too big to allocate. Force failure (in sys alloc) */
05115     else {
05116       nb = pad_request(bytes);
05117       if (gm->treemap != 0 && (mem = tmalloc_large(gm, nb)) != 0) {
05118         check_malloced_chunk(gm, mem, nb);
05119         goto postaction;
05120       }
05121     }
05122 
05123     if (nb <= gm->dvsize) {
05124       size_t rsize = gm->dvsize - nb;
05125       mchunkptr p = gm->dv;
05126       if (rsize >= MIN_CHUNK_SIZE) { /* split dv */
05127         mchunkptr r = gm->dv = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
05128         gm->dvsize = rsize;
05129         set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(r, rsize);
05130         set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(gm, p, nb);
05131       }
05132       else { /* exhaust dv */
05133         size_t dvs = gm->dvsize;
05134         gm->dvsize = 0;
05135         gm->dv = 0;
05136         set_inuse_and_pinuse(gm, p, dvs);
05137       }
05138       mem = chunk2mem(p);
05139       check_malloced_chunk(gm, mem, nb);
05140       goto postaction;
05141     }
05142 
05143     else if (nb < gm->topsize) { /* Split top */
05144       size_t rsize = gm->topsize -= nb;
05145       mchunkptr p = gm->top;
05146       mchunkptr r = gm->top = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
05147       r->head = rsize | PINUSE_BIT;
05148       set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(gm, p, nb);
05149       mem = chunk2mem(p);
05150       check_top_chunk(gm, gm->top);
05151       check_malloced_chunk(gm, mem, nb);
05152       goto postaction;
05153     }
05154 
05155     mem = sys_alloc(gm, nb);
05156 
05157   postaction:
05158     POSTACTION(gm);
05159     return mem;
05160   }
05161 
05162   return 0;
05163 }
05164 
05165 void dlfree(void* mem) {
05166   /*
05167      Consolidate freed chunks with preceeding or succeeding bordering
05168      free chunks, if they exist, and then place in a bin.  Intermixed
05169      with special cases for top, dv, mmapped chunks, and usage errors.
05170   */
05171 
05172   if (mem != 0) {
05173     mchunkptr p  = mem2chunk(mem);
05174 #if FOOTERS
05175     mstate fm = get_mstate_for(p);
05176     if (!ok_magic(fm)) {
05177       USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(fm, p);
05178       return;
05179     }
05180 #else /* FOOTERS */
05181 #define fm gm
05182 #endif /* FOOTERS */
05183     if (!PREACTION(fm)) {
05184       check_inuse_chunk(fm, p);
05185       if (RTCHECK(ok_address(fm, p) && ok_inuse(p))) {
05186         size_t psize = chunksize(p);
05187         mchunkptr next = chunk_plus_offset(p, psize);
05188         if (!pinuse(p)) {
05189           size_t prevsize = p->prev_foot;
05190           if (is_mmapped(p)) {
05191             char* mm = (char*)p - prevsize;
05192             psize += prevsize + MMAP_FOOT_PAD;
05193             if (CALL_MUNMAP(*(void**)mm, mm, psize) == 0)
05194               fm->footprint -= psize;
05195             goto postaction;
05196           }
05197           else {
05198             mchunkptr prev = chunk_minus_offset(p, prevsize);
05199             psize += prevsize;
05200             p = prev;
05201             if (RTCHECK(ok_address(fm, prev))) { /* consolidate backward */
05202               if (p != fm->dv) {
05203                 unlink_chunk(fm, p, prevsize);
05204               }
05205               else if ((next->head & INUSE_BITS) == INUSE_BITS) {
05206                 fm->dvsize = psize;
05207                 set_free_with_pinuse(p, psize, next);
05208                 goto postaction;
05209               }
05210             }
05211             else
05212               goto erroraction;
05213           }
05214         }
05215 
05216         if (RTCHECK(ok_next(p, next) && ok_pinuse(next))) {
05217           if (!cinuse(next)) {  /* consolidate forward */
05218             if (next == fm->top) {
05219               size_t tsize = fm->topsize += psize;
05220               fm->top = p;
05221               p->head = tsize | PINUSE_BIT;
05222               if (p == fm->dv) {
05223                 fm->dv = 0;
05224                 fm->dvsize = 0;
05225               }
05226               if (should_trim(fm, tsize))
05227                 sys_trim(fm, 0);
05228               goto postaction;
05229             }
05230             else if (next == fm->dv) {
05231               size_t dsize = fm->dvsize += psize;
05232               fm->dv = p;
05233               set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(p, dsize);
05234               goto postaction;
05235             }
05236             else {
05237               size_t nsize = chunksize(next);
05238               psize += nsize;
05239               unlink_chunk(fm, next, nsize);
05240               set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(p, psize);
05241               if (p == fm->dv) {
05242                 fm->dvsize = psize;
05243                 goto postaction;
05244               }
05245             }
05246           }
05247           else
05248             set_free_with_pinuse(p, psize, next);
05249 
05250           if (is_small(psize)) {
05251             insert_small_chunk(fm, p, psize);
05252             check_free_chunk(fm, p);
05253           }
05254           else {
05255             tchunkptr tp = (tchunkptr)p;
05256             insert_large_chunk(fm, tp, psize);
05257             check_free_chunk(fm, p);
05258             if (--fm->release_checks == 0)
05259               release_unused_segments(fm);
05260           }
05261           goto postaction;
05262         }
05263       }
05264     erroraction:
05265       USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(fm, p);
05266     postaction:
05267       POSTACTION(fm);
05268     }
05269   }
05270 #if !FOOTERS
05271 #undef fm
05272 #endif /* FOOTERS */
05273 }
05274 
05275 void* dlcalloc(size_t n_elements, size_t elem_size) {
05276   void* mem;
05277   size_t req = 0;
05278   if (n_elements != 0) {
05279     req = n_elements * elem_size;
05280     if (((n_elements | elem_size) & ~(size_t)0xffff) &&
05281         (req / n_elements != elem_size))
05282       req = MAX_SIZE_T; /* force downstream failure on overflow */
05283   }
05284   mem = dlmalloc(req);
05285   if (mem != 0 && calloc_must_clear(mem2chunk(mem)))
05286     memset(mem, 0, req);
05287   return mem;
05288 }
05289 
05290 void* dlrealloc(void* oldmem, size_t bytes) {
05291   if (oldmem == 0)
05292     return dlmalloc(bytes);
05293 #ifdef REALLOC_ZERO_BYTES_FREES
05294   if (bytes == 0) {
05295     dlfree(oldmem);
05296     return 0;
05297   }
05298 #endif /* REALLOC_ZERO_BYTES_FREES */
05299   else {
05300 #if ! FOOTERS
05301     mstate m = gm;
05302 #else /* FOOTERS */
05303     mstate m = get_mstate_for(mem2chunk(oldmem));
05304     if (!ok_magic(m)) {
05305       USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(m, oldmem);
05306       return 0;
05307     }
05308 #endif /* FOOTERS */
05309     return internal_realloc(m, oldmem, bytes);
05310   }
05311 }
05312 
05313 void* dlmemalign(size_t alignment, size_t bytes) {
05314   return internal_memalign(gm, alignment, bytes);
05315 }
05316 
05317 void** dlindependent_calloc(size_t n_elements, size_t elem_size,
05318                                  void* chunks[]) {
05319   size_t sz = elem_size; /* serves as 1-element array */
05320   return ialloc(gm, n_elements, &sz, 3, chunks);
05321 }
05322 
05323 void** dlindependent_comalloc(size_t n_elements, size_t sizes[],
05324                                    void* chunks[]) {
05325   return ialloc(gm, n_elements, sizes, 0, chunks);
05326 }
05327 
05328 void* dlvalloc(size_t bytes) {
05329   size_t pagesz;
05330   ensure_initialization();
05331   pagesz = mparams.page_size;
05332   return dlmemalign(pagesz, bytes);
05333 }
05334 
05335 void* dlpvalloc(size_t bytes) {
05336   size_t pagesz;
05337   ensure_initialization();
05338   pagesz = mparams.page_size;
05339   return dlmemalign(pagesz, (bytes + pagesz - SIZE_T_ONE) & ~(pagesz - SIZE_T_ONE));
05340 }
05341 
05342 int dlmalloc_trim(size_t pad) {
05343   int result = 0;
05344   ensure_initialization();
05345   if (!PREACTION(gm)) {
05346     result = sys_trim(gm, pad);
05347     POSTACTION(gm);
05348   }
05349   return result;
05350 }
05351 
05352 size_t dlmalloc_footprint(void) {
05353   return gm->footprint;
05354 }
05355 
05356 size_t dlmalloc_max_footprint(void) {
05357   return gm->max_footprint;
05358 }
05359 
05360 #if !NO_MALLINFO
05361 struct mallinfo dlmallinfo(void) {
05362   return internal_mallinfo(gm);
05363 }
05364 #endif /* NO_MALLINFO */
05365 
05366 void dlmalloc_stats() {
05367   internal_malloc_stats(gm);
05368 }
05369 
05370 int dlmallopt(int param_number, int value) {
05371   return change_mparam(param_number, value);
05372 }
05373 
05374 #endif /* !ONLY_MSPACES */
05375 
05376 size_t dlmalloc_usable_size(void* mem) {
05377   if (mem != 0) {
05378     mchunkptr p = mem2chunk(mem);
05379     if (is_inuse(p))
05380       return chunksize(p) - overhead_for(p);
05381   }
05382   return 0;
05383 }
05384 
05385 /* ----------------------------- user mspaces ---------------------------- */
05386 
05387 #if MSPACES
05388 
05389 static mstate init_user_mstate(char* tbase, size_t tsize) {
05390   size_t msize = pad_request(sizeof(struct malloc_state));
05391   mchunkptr mn;
05392   mchunkptr msp = align_as_chunk(tbase);
05393   mstate m = (mstate)(chunk2mem(msp));
05394   memset(m, 0, msize);
05395   INITIAL_LOCK(&m->mutex);
05396   msp->head = (msize|INUSE_BITS);
05397   m->seg.base = m->least_addr = tbase;
05398   m->seg.size = m->footprint = m->max_footprint = tsize;
05399   m->magic = mparams.magic;
05400   m->release_checks = MAX_RELEASE_CHECK_RATE;
05401   m->mflags = mparams.default_mflags;
05402   m->extp = 0;
05403   m->exts = 0;
05404   disable_contiguous(m);
05405   init_bins(m);
05406   mn = next_chunk(mem2chunk(m));
05407   init_top(m, mn, (size_t)((tbase + tsize) - (char*)mn) - TOP_FOOT_SIZE);
05408   check_top_chunk(m, m->top);
05409   return m;
05410 }
05411 
05412 mspace create_mspace(size_t capacity, int locked) {
05413   mstate m = 0;
05414   size_t msize;
05415   ensure_initialization();
05416   msize = pad_request(sizeof(struct malloc_state));
05417   if (capacity < (size_t) -(msize + TOP_FOOT_SIZE + mparams.page_size)) {
05418     size_t rs = ((capacity == 0)? mparams.granularity :
05419                  (capacity + TOP_FOOT_SIZE + msize));
05420     size_t tsize = granularity_align(rs);
05421     char* tbase = (char*)(CALL_MMAP(tsize, 0));
05422     if (tbase != CMFAIL) {
05423       m = init_user_mstate(tbase, tsize);
05424       m->seg.sflags = USE_MMAP_BIT;
05425       set_lock(m, locked);
05426     }
05427   }
05428   return (mspace)m;
05429 }
05430 
05431 mspace create_mspace_with_base(void* base, size_t capacity, int locked) {
05432   mstate m = 0;
05433   size_t msize;
05434   ensure_initialization();
05435   msize = pad_request(sizeof(struct malloc_state));
05436   if (capacity > msize + TOP_FOOT_SIZE &&
05437       capacity < (size_t) -(msize + TOP_FOOT_SIZE + mparams.page_size)) {
05438     m = init_user_mstate((char*)base, capacity);
05439     m->seg.sflags = EXTERN_BIT;
05440     set_lock(m, locked);
05441   }
05442   return (mspace)m;
05443 }
05444 
05445 int mspace_track_large_chunks(mspace msp, int enable) {
05446   int ret = 0;
05447   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05448   if (!PREACTION(ms)) {
05449     if (!use_mmap(ms))
05450       ret = 1;
05451     if (!enable)
05452       enable_mmap(ms);
05453     else
05454       disable_mmap(ms);
05455     POSTACTION(ms);
05456   }
05457   return ret;
05458 }
05459 
05460 size_t destroy_mspace(mspace msp) {
05461   size_t freed = 0;
05462   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05463   if (ok_magic(ms)) {
05464     msegmentptr sp = &ms->seg;
05465     while (sp != 0) {
05466       char* base = sp->base;
05467       size_t size = sp->size;
05468       flag_t flag = sp->sflags;
05469       sp = sp->next;
05470       if ((flag & USE_MMAP_BIT) && !(flag & EXTERN_BIT) &&
05471           CALL_MUNMAP(0/*segment*/, base, size) == 0)
05472         freed += size;
05473     }
05474   }
05475   else {
05476     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05477   }
05478   return freed;
05479 }
05480 
05481 /*
05482   mspace versions of routines are near-clones of the global
05483   versions. This is not so nice but better than the alternatives.
05484 */
05485 
05486 static FORCEINLINE void* mspace_malloc_implementation(mstate ms, size_t bytes, unsigned flags) {
05487   if (!PREACTION(ms)) {
05488     void* mem;
05489     size_t nb = bytes;
05490     if (!(flags & M2_ALWAYS_MMAP)) {
05491       if (bytes <= MAX_SMALL_REQUEST) {
05492         bindex_t idx;
05493         binmap_t smallbits;
05494         nb = (bytes < MIN_REQUEST)? MIN_CHUNK_SIZE : pad_request(bytes);
05495         idx = small_index(nb);
05496         smallbits = ms->smallmap >> idx;
05497 
05498         if ((smallbits & 0x3U) != 0) { /* Remainderless fit to a smallbin. */
05499           mchunkptr b, p;
05500           idx += ~smallbits & 1;       /* Uses next bin if idx empty */
05501           b = smallbin_at(ms, idx);
05502           p = b->fd;
05503           assert(chunksize(p) == small_index2size(idx));
05504           unlink_first_small_chunk(ms, b, p, idx);
05505           set_inuse_and_pinuse(ms, p, small_index2size(idx));
05506           mem = chunk2mem(p);
05507           check_malloced_chunk(ms, mem, nb);
05508           goto postaction;
05509         }
05510 
05511         else if (nb > ms->dvsize) {
05512           if (smallbits != 0) { /* Use chunk in next nonempty smallbin */
05513             mchunkptr b, p, r;
05514             size_t rsize;
05515             bindex_t i;
05516             binmap_t leftbits = (smallbits << idx) & left_bits(idx2bit(idx));
05517             binmap_t leastbit = least_bit(leftbits);
05518             compute_bit2idx(leastbit, i);
05519             b = smallbin_at(ms, i);
05520             p = b->fd;
05521             assert(chunksize(p) == small_index2size(i));
05522             unlink_first_small_chunk(ms, b, p, i);
05523             rsize = small_index2size(i) - nb;
05524             /* Fit here cannot be remainderless if 4byte sizes */
05525             if (SIZE_T_SIZE != 4 && rsize < MIN_CHUNK_SIZE)
05526               set_inuse_and_pinuse(ms, p, small_index2size(i));
05527             else {
05528               set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(ms, p, nb);
05529               r = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
05530               set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(r, rsize);
05531               replace_dv(ms, r, rsize);
05532             }
05533             mem = chunk2mem(p);
05534             check_malloced_chunk(ms, mem, nb);
05535             goto postaction;
05536           }
05537 
05538           else if (ms->treemap != 0 && (mem = tmalloc_small(ms, nb)) != 0) {
05539             check_malloced_chunk(ms, mem, nb);
05540             goto postaction;
05541           }
05542         }
05543       }
05544       else if (bytes >= MAX_REQUEST)
05545         nb = MAX_SIZE_T; /* Too big to allocate. Force failure (in sys alloc) */
05546       else {
05547         nb = pad_request(bytes);
05548         if (ms->treemap != 0 && (mem = tmalloc_large(ms, nb)) != 0) {
05549           check_malloced_chunk(ms, mem, nb);
05550           goto postaction;
05551         }
05552       }
05553 
05554       if (nb <= ms->dvsize) {
05555         size_t rsize = ms->dvsize - nb;
05556         mchunkptr p = ms->dv;
05557         if (rsize >= MIN_CHUNK_SIZE) { /* split dv */
05558           mchunkptr r = ms->dv = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
05559           ms->dvsize = rsize;
05560           set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(r, rsize);
05561           set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(ms, p, nb);
05562         }
05563         else { /* exhaust dv */
05564           size_t dvs = ms->dvsize;
05565           ms->dvsize = 0;
05566           ms->dv = 0;
05567           set_inuse_and_pinuse(ms, p, dvs);
05568         }
05569         mem = chunk2mem(p);
05570         check_malloced_chunk(ms, mem, nb);
05571         goto postaction;
05572       }
05573 
05574       else if (nb < ms->topsize) { /* Split top */
05575         size_t rsize = ms->topsize -= nb;
05576         mchunkptr p = ms->top;
05577         mchunkptr r = ms->top = chunk_plus_offset(p, nb);
05578         r->head = rsize | PINUSE_BIT;
05579         set_size_and_pinuse_of_inuse_chunk(ms, p, nb);
05580         mem = chunk2mem(p);
05581         check_top_chunk(ms, ms->top);
05582         check_malloced_chunk(ms, mem, nb);
05583         goto postaction;
05584       }
05585     }
05586 
05587     mem = sys_alloc(ms, nb, flags);
05588 
05589   postaction:
05590     POSTACTION(ms);
05591     return mem;
05592   }
05593 
05594   return 0;
05595 }
05596 void* mspace_malloc(mspace msp, size_t bytes) {
05597   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05598   if (!ok_magic(ms)) {
05599     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05600     return 0;
05601   }
05602   return mspace_malloc_implementation(ms, bytes, 0);
05603 }
05604 void* mspace_malloc2(mspace msp, size_t bytes, size_t alignment, unsigned flags) {
05605   void* mem;
05606   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05607   if (!ok_magic(ms)) {
05608     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05609     return 0;
05610   }
05611   if (alignment <= MALLOC_ALIGNMENT)
05612     mem = mspace_malloc_implementation(ms, bytes, flags);
05613   else
05614     mem = internal_memalign(ms, alignment, bytes, flags);
05615   if (mem && (flags & M2_ZERO_MEMORY)) {
05616     mchunkptr p = mem2chunk(mem);
05617     if (calloc_must_clear(p))
05618       memset(mem, 0, chunksize(p) - overhead_for(p));
05619   }
05620   return mem;
05621 }
05622 
05623 void mspace_free(mspace msp, void* mem) {
05624   if (mem != 0) {
05625     mchunkptr p = mem2chunk(mem);
05626 #if FOOTERS
05627     mstate fm = get_mstate_for(p);
05628     msp = msp; /* placate people compiling -Wunused */
05629 #else /* FOOTERS */
05630     mstate fm = (mstate)msp;
05631 #endif /* FOOTERS */
05632     if (!ok_magic(fm)) {
05633       USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(fm, p);
05634       return;
05635     }
05636     if (!PREACTION(fm)) {
05637       check_inuse_chunk(fm, p);
05638       if (RTCHECK(ok_address(fm, p) && ok_inuse(p))) {
05639         size_t psize = chunksize(p);
05640         mchunkptr next = chunk_plus_offset(p, psize);
05641         if (!pinuse(p)) {
05642           size_t prevsize = p->prev_foot;
05643           if (is_mmapped(p)) {
05644             char* mm = (char*)p - prevsize;
05645             psize += prevsize + MMAP_FOOT_PAD;
05646             if (CALL_MUNMAP(*(void**)mm, mm, psize) == 0)
05647               fm->footprint -= psize;
05648             goto postaction;
05649           }
05650           else {
05651             mchunkptr prev = chunk_minus_offset(p, prevsize);
05652             psize += prevsize;
05653             p = prev;
05654             if (RTCHECK(ok_address(fm, prev))) { /* consolidate backward */
05655               if (p != fm->dv) {
05656                 unlink_chunk(fm, p, prevsize);
05657               }
05658               else if ((next->head & INUSE_BITS) == INUSE_BITS) {
05659                 fm->dvsize = psize;
05660                 set_free_with_pinuse(p, psize, next);
05661                 goto postaction;
05662               }
05663             }
05664             else
05665               goto erroraction;
05666           }
05667         }
05668 
05669         if (RTCHECK(ok_next(p, next) && ok_pinuse(next))) {
05670           if (!cinuse(next)) {  /* consolidate forward */
05671             if (next == fm->top) {
05672               size_t tsize = fm->topsize += psize;
05673               fm->top = p;
05674               p->head = tsize | PINUSE_BIT;
05675               if (p == fm->dv) {
05676                 fm->dv = 0;
05677                 fm->dvsize = 0;
05678               }
05679               if (should_trim(fm, tsize))
05680                 sys_trim(fm, 0);
05681               goto postaction;
05682             }
05683             else if (next == fm->dv) {
05684               size_t dsize = fm->dvsize += psize;
05685               fm->dv = p;
05686               set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(p, dsize);
05687               goto postaction;
05688             }
05689             else {
05690               size_t nsize = chunksize(next);
05691               psize += nsize;
05692               unlink_chunk(fm, next, nsize);
05693               set_size_and_pinuse_of_free_chunk(p, psize);
05694               if (p == fm->dv) {
05695                 fm->dvsize = psize;
05696                 goto postaction;
05697               }
05698             }
05699           }
05700           else
05701             set_free_with_pinuse(p, psize, next);
05702 
05703           if (is_small(psize)) {
05704             insert_small_chunk(fm, p, psize);
05705             check_free_chunk(fm, p);
05706           }
05707           else {
05708             tchunkptr tp = (tchunkptr)p;
05709             insert_large_chunk(fm, tp, psize);
05710             check_free_chunk(fm, p);
05711             if (--fm->release_checks == 0)
05712               release_unused_segments(fm);
05713           }
05714           goto postaction;
05715         }
05716       }
05717     erroraction:
05718       USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(fm, p);
05719     postaction:
05720       POSTACTION(fm);
05721     }
05722   }
05723 }
05724 
05725 void* mspace_calloc(mspace msp, size_t n_elements, size_t elem_size) {
05726   void* mem;
05727   size_t req = 0;
05728   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05729   if (!ok_magic(ms)) {
05730     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05731     return 0;
05732   }
05733   if (n_elements != 0) {
05734     req = n_elements * elem_size;
05735     if (((n_elements | elem_size) & ~(size_t)0xffff) &&
05736         (req / n_elements != elem_size))
05737       req = MAX_SIZE_T; /* force downstream failure on overflow */
05738   }
05739   mem = internal_malloc(ms, req, 0);
05740   if (mem != 0) {
05741     mchunkptr p = mem2chunk(mem);
05742     if (calloc_must_clear(p))
05743       memset(mem, 0, chunksize(p) - overhead_for(p));
05744   }
05745   return mem;
05746 }
05747 
05748 void* mspace_realloc2(mspace msp, void* oldmem, size_t bytes, size_t alignment, unsigned flags) {
05749   if (oldmem == 0)
05750     return mspace_malloc2(msp, bytes, alignment, flags);
05751 #ifdef REALLOC_ZERO_BYTES_FREES
05752   if (bytes == 0) {
05753     mspace_free(msp, oldmem);
05754     return 0;
05755   }
05756 #endif /* REALLOC_ZERO_BYTES_FREES */
05757   else {
05758     void* mem;
05759     mchunkptr p  = mem2chunk(oldmem);
05760     size_t oldsize = chunksize(p) - overhead_for(p);
05761 #if FOOTERS
05762     mstate ms = get_mstate_for(p);
05763 #else /* FOOTERS */
05764     mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05765 #endif /* FOOTERS */
05766     if (!ok_magic(ms)) {
05767       USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05768       return 0;
05769     }
05770     mem = internal_realloc(ms, oldmem, bytes, alignment, flags);
05771     if (mem && (flags & M2_ZERO_MEMORY) && bytes > oldsize) {
05772       p = mem2chunk(mem);
05773       if (calloc_must_clear(p)) {
05774         size_t newsize = chunksize(p) - overhead_for(p);
05775         memset((char*)mem + oldsize, 0, newsize - oldsize);
05776       }
05777     }
05778     return mem;
05779   }
05780 }
05781 void* mspace_realloc(mspace msp, void* oldmem, size_t bytes) {
05782   return mspace_realloc2(msp, oldmem, bytes, 0, 0);
05783 }
05784 
05785 void* mspace_memalign(mspace msp, size_t alignment, size_t bytes) {
05786   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05787   if (!ok_magic(ms)) {
05788     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05789     return 0;
05790   }
05791   return internal_memalign(ms, alignment, bytes, 0);
05792 }
05793 
05794 void** mspace_independent_calloc(mspace msp, size_t n_elements,
05795                                  size_t elem_size, void* chunks[]) {
05796   size_t sz = elem_size; /* serves as 1-element array */
05797   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05798   if (!ok_magic(ms)) {
05799     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05800     return 0;
05801   }
05802   return ialloc(ms, n_elements, &sz, 3, chunks);
05803 }

05805 void** mspace_independent_comalloc(mspace msp, size_t n_elements,
05806                                    size_t sizes[], void* chunks[]) {
05807   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05808   if (!ok_magic(ms)) {
05809     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05810     return 0;
05811   }
05812   return ialloc(ms, n_elements, sizes, 0, chunks);
05813 }
05814 
05815 int mspace_trim(mspace msp, size_t pad) {
05816   int result = 0;
05817   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05818   if (ok_magic(ms)) {
05819     if (!PREACTION(ms)) {
05820       result = sys_trim(ms, pad);
05821       POSTACTION(ms);
05822     }
05823   }
05824   else {
05825     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05826   }
05827   return result;
05828 }

05830 void mspace_malloc_stats(mspace msp) {
05831   mstate ms = (mstate)msp;
05832   if (ok_magic(ms)) {
05833     internal_malloc_stats(ms);
05834   }
05835   else {
05836     USAGE_ERROR_ACTION(ms,ms);
05837   }
05838 }

05876 size_t mspace_usable_size(void* mem) {
05877   if (mem != 0) {
05878     mchunkptr p = mem2chunk(mem);
05879     if (is_inuse(p))
05880       return chunksize(p) - overhead_for(p);
05881   }
05882   return 0;
05883 }

05891 
05892 /* -------------------- Alternative MORECORE functions ------------------- */
05893 
05894 /*
05895   Guidelines for creating a custom version of MORECORE:
05896 
05897   * For best performance, MORECORE should allocate in multiples of pagesize.
05898   * MORECORE may allocate more memory than requested. (Or even less,
05899       but this will usually result in a malloc failure.)
05900   * MORECORE must not allocate memory when given argument zero, but
05901       instead return one past the end address of memory from previous
05902       nonzero call.
05903   * For best performance, consecutive calls to MORECORE with positive
05904       arguments should return increasing addresses, indicating that
05905       space has been contiguously extended.
05906   * Even though consecutive calls to MORECORE need not return contiguous
05907       addresses, it must be OK for malloc'ed chunks to span multiple
05908       regions in those cases where they do happen to be contiguous.
05909   * MORECORE need not handle negative arguments -- it may instead
05910       just return MFAIL when given negative arguments.
05911       Negative arguments are always multiples of pagesize. MORECORE
05912       must not misinterpret negative args as large positive unsigned
05913       args. You can suppress all such calls from even occurring by defining
05914       MORECORE_CANNOT_TRIM,
05915 
05916   As an example alternative MORECORE, here is a custom allocator
05917   kindly contributed for pre-OSX macOS.  It uses virtually but not
05918   necessarily physically contiguous non-paged memory (locked in,
05919   present and won't get swapped out).  You can use it by uncommenting
05920   this section, adding some #includes, and setting up the appropriate
05921   defines above:
05922 
05923       #define MORECORE osMoreCore
05924 
05925   There is also a shutdown routine that should somehow be called for
05926   cleanup upon program exit.
05927 
05928   #define MAX_POOL_ENTRIES 100
05929   #define MINIMUM_MORECORE_SIZE  (64 * 1024U)
05930   static int next_os_pool;
05931   void *our_os_pools[MAX_POOL_ENTRIES];
05932 
05933   void *osMoreCore(int size)
05934   {
05935     void *ptr = 0;
05936     static void *sbrk_top = 0;
05937 
05938     if (size > 0)
05939     {
05940       if (size < MINIMUM_MORECORE_SIZE)
05941          size = MINIMUM_MORECORE_SIZE;
05942       if (CurrentExecutionLevel() == kTaskLevel)
05943          ptr = PoolAllocateResident(size + RM_PAGE_SIZE, 0);
05944       if (ptr == 0)
05945       {
05946         return (void *) MFAIL;
05947       }
05948       // save ptrs so they can be freed during cleanup
05949       our_os_pools[next_os_pool] = ptr;
05950       next_os_pool++;
05951       ptr = (void *) ((((size_t) ptr) + RM_PAGE_MASK) & ~RM_PAGE_MASK);
05952       sbrk_top = (char *) ptr + size;
05953       return ptr;
05954     }
05955     else if (size < 0)
05956     {
05957       // we don't currently support shrink behavior
05958       return (void *) MFAIL;
05959     }
05960     else
05961     {
05962       return sbrk_top;
05963     }
05964   }
05965 
05966   // cleanup any allocated memory pools
05967   // called as last thing before shutting down driver
05968 
05969   void osCleanupMem(void)
05970   {
05971     void **ptr;
05972 
05973     for (ptr = our_os_pools; ptr < &our_os_pools[MAX_POOL_ENTRIES]; ptr++)
05974       if (*ptr)
05975       {
05976          PoolDeallocate(*ptr);
05977          *ptr = 0;
05978       }
05979   }
05980 
05981 */
05982
